replies.body: When did {{champion:41}} stop being broken?

> [{quoted}](name=g07h4xf00,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tNBRHbiv,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-10-30T23:39:41.749+0000)
>
> When did {{champion:41}} stop being broken?

He ate a Mango, it was not K.
How is he broken?
He has 40% armor pen AoE crits. With bonus true damage on basic attacks. And missing health healing. But he has gotten some nerfs with his health and mana sustain.

%40 isn't that over the top. It's enough to still deal considerable damage to someone who's building full armor (Taric), but it's not enough to make it so that using armor against him in general is useless. The true damage basic attacks may do a lot of damage, but you're still rather squishy, and quite rarely a good idea to get in that range as him. It's mostly for deterrence than anything. And the %missing HP heals you speak of are FAR more based of of flat health regen. The Oranges heal flat amount + %15 of missing HP (Which at VERY most, is going to be a bonus 350-ish HP, but that's assuming you have no armor items and build 3000 health), which the level of heals doesn't really matter, because it's more used as a {{item:3140}} than a heal. Even then, Gangplank takes HUGE amounts of skill to use effectively. Is he a strong champion? Very much so. Does he take a large amount of skill to use properly? Hell yes, I'd argue THE most. {{champion:55}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:122}} These guys are far closer to the term "Broken". Hit the buttons, do stupid damage requiring very little skill to master. Gangplank might be a similar threat, but he takes so much skill to do it effectively and consistently, that he's only a threat in master or challenjour, and pick/ban in worlds. 


Even THEN, Other than his barrels/burning sword/oranges, what else can he do? His ult scales off of wizard power, so it doesn't deal stupid damage unless you built AP like a mad man. He can pretend to not have had a rework and run around spamming his Q at every second he can and be useless. And what else? Nothing. His kit is very simple to understand, but very difficult to master. If we got rid of the armor pen on his barrels, I'd bet he would go to JUST above trash tier

These are dark times sir, dark times indeed .__.

It kinda is. They said when they reworked Ashe that they weren't going to remove crit as a mechanic. Ashe was not going to be an example of an adc without crit, but a champion who used crit differently. They are now making good on that promise by making crit mean more than just "I do xx% more damage now".

I do understand that crit was kind of pointless for a long time now and applauded riot for trying to give Crit more use in game, but it seems like everything is going to be about crit damage now. even {{item:3078}} is losing its AP just so they can give it more Crit.

I guess it doesn't bother me that much because the AP isn't really being replaced by crit, I believe it's actually being replaced by the cdr that's being added to it. The entire sheen change makes sense to me because now the item is giving you the two stats that you will need 100% of the time in order to use sheen, cdr to use it more often, and mana to use it longer. If you're going to complain about the extra crit complain about it replacing AD and AS which is what is really going to hurt more, because a lot of champions go Trinity and then full tank because the raw offensive stats plus the passives are what makes it a great standalone offensive item.
